message: This is the first round, and I'm offering you a product for $100. I'm not sure what you think it's worth, but I'm willing to give you a chance to try it out. If you buy it, you'll find out its quality afterwards. If you don't like it, we can try again in the next round.
I'd like to take the chance and buy the product.

Great, glad you took the chance! Now, I'm offering you another product for $100. I know you just bought a low-quality product, but I want to give you a chance to experience the difference. This one might be the better version of what you just bought. What do you think?
I'm not sure if I want to take another chance on a low-quality product. Can we try again in the next round?

I completely understand your concerns! I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to give you a guarantee. If you buy it, I'll give you a full refund if you're not completely satisfied. This way, you can experience the quality without any risk. Would you like to take a chance?
I'm willing to take a chance with the guarantee. I'll buy the product.

Great, glad you're willing to take a chance! Now, I want to give you a special offer. Since you've already bought two high-quality products, I'll give you a discount on this one. You can buy it for $90, and I'll throw in a free accessory that's worth $10. This is a one-time offer, so what do you say?
I'll take the offer! The discount and free accessory make it an even better deal.

I'm glad you like the deal! However, I need to correct myself - I made a mistake earlier. There's no discount or free accessory this time. The price remains at $100. But I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality, and it's a unique opportunity to experience it. What do you think?
I'll still take the chance on the high-quality product, even without the discount or accessory. The value of the product is worth more than the price to me.

I'm intrigued by the 'double-or-nothing' deal. I'll take the chance on the high-quality product, and I'm hoping to get the second high-quality product for free.
